title: hardcoded api secret & api key in com.reddit.frontpage
content:
hi security team,
in file Resources/Resources.arsc/res/values/strings.xml
i have found
<string name="twitter_consumer_key">███</string>
<string name="twitter_consumer_secret">███</string>
It shouldn't be disclosed to third parties it meant for deveoplers as per https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/authentication/oauth-2-0/bearer-tokens
poc:-
curl --user "██████:███" --data 'grant_type=client_credentials' 'https://api.twitter.
com/oauth2/token'
response:-
{"token_type":"bearer","access_token":"████"}
it meant to request successful as official docs say https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/authentication/oauth-2-0/bearer-tokens
Impact
leakage of twitter_consumer_key and twitter_consumer_secret to public it meant for deveoplers only
steps: Locate the file Resources/Resources.arsc/res/values/strings.xml in the application package.
Extract and inspect the strings.xml file to find hardcoded Twitter API keys: 'twitter_consumer_key' and 'twitter_consumer_secret'.
Use the extracted keys to authenticate with Twitter's API as demonstrated in the POC curl command.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves hardcoded Twitter API keys (consumer key and consumer secret) in the application's resources file. These keys are meant for developer use only and should not be exposed in the application. Exposure of these keys allows unauthorized access to Twitter's API, potentially leading to misuse of the application's Twitter integration.
reason: The discovery of this vulnerability is straightforward as it involves inspecting a common file (strings.xml) in the application package, which is a standard practice in mobile app security testing. The steps to reproduce are simple and do not involve complex interactions or states.
